title: Horror crash shuts down Main South Road | 7NEWS
description: A motorbike and car collided at the intersection of Main South Road and Sun Valley Road just after 5pm, resulting in multiple patients being treated for serious injuries. Police redirected traffic on South Road in both directions while major crash investigators were dispatched to the scene. Witnesses described the crash scene as chaotic. title: Aldinga grandfather allegedly murdered by neighbour at caravan park | 7NEWS
description: A 72-year-old grandfather, Gary Hallam, was allegedly murdered at the Port Wollonga Tourist Park in Aldinga by his 42-year-old neighbour, who turned himself in to police and has been charged with murder. The victim was a well-liked long-term resident of the caravan park who was days away from completing a cabin he was building. This incident marks the third murder in South Australia within one week, prompting police to urge the community to resolve disputes peacefully. title: Major drug busts across Adelaide suburbs | 7NEWS
description: Five people, including a 17-year-old boy, have been arrested following police raids across multiple Adelaide suburbs that uncovered drug laboratories and cannabis grow houses. Detectives and Star Group officers executed searches at properties in Brooklyn Park, Allgate, Rivoli, Oaklands Park, Huntfield Heights and a storage facility near Adelaide Airport. Police seized cannabis, fantasy, MDMA, methamphetamine, drug manufacturing equipment, two batons, $50,000 in cash and counterfeit currency, with all suspects charged with drug trafficking and related offences. title: Massage worker charged with assaulting multiple clients | 7NEWS
description: A 61-year-old massage parlour worker has been charged with sexually assaulting multiple clients at businesses located in shopping centres on the Gold Coast and in Brisbane. The alleged incidents involve a 17-year-old girl at a Southport location in December and a 29-year-old woman at Chermside in August. Police believe there may be additional victims and are urging witnesses to come forward, with the accused scheduled to appear in court in February. title: Ancient history exam blunder sees students taught wrong Roman ruler | 7NEWS
description: An investigation reveals that 140 ancient history students across nine Queensland schools were incorrectly taught about Augustus instead of Julius Caesar for their final exams due to poor communication from the curriculum authority. The education blunder resulted in the sacking of two QCAA board members, including teachers union boss Cresta Richardson. The revelation coincided with Queensland Year 12 students receiving their university offers, with over 16,000 students accepting places through QTAC. title: A New Jersey police officer was deemed a 'hero' after entering the frigid waters of Lake Mohawk
description: New Jersey police officer, Michael Poon, was deemed a 'hero' after entering the frigid waters of Lake Mohawk to rescue a dog stuck in the frozen lake. #rescue #lake #winter #frozenlake #animal

title: Moment firework lands on field before NFL game
description: A rogue firework has crashed onto the field before a Ravens and Patriots NFL game at the M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore, Maryland. A Baltimore Ravens spokesperson told the Daily Mail that no one was injured and the incident was under investigation to determine what caused it. #firework #NFL #Baltimore #sport

title: Diver pinned by great white shark off Ocean Reef | 7NEWS
description: A diver was pinned to the ocean floor by a great white shark off Ocean Reef, with the shark circling him for approximately 10 minutes while his oxygen depleted. Tanvir Dillon wedged himself in a ledge to hide from the predator before eventually signalling his dive mates and making it safely back to the boat. Despite the terrifying encounter, the experienced diver emphasises the importance of staying calm during such crises and respects that divers are visitors in the shark's territory.
